text.p: Let [mathjaxinline]\mathcal{B} = \{ v_1; v_2\}[/mathjaxinline] as pictured; this is a basis of [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^2[/mathjaxinline].
Given the [mathjaxinline]w[/mathjaxinline] in the image, what is [mathjaxinline][w]_{\mathcal{B}}[/mathjaxinline]?

font.p: We can write [mathjaxinline]w[/mathjaxinline] as a linear combination of the basis vectors in order: [mathjaxinline]w = -1 v_1 + 2v_2[/mathjaxinline]. Hence [mathjaxinline][w]_{\mathcal{B}} =\left[\begin{array}{c} -1 \\ 2 \end{array} \right][/mathjaxinline].
